name: places/ChIJueVfDLFZwokRAIK4xHNWg2c
formattedAddress: 451 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 451 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: I have been taking GoBus to travel to NYC and Boston for a while now and had racked up a lot of points. Not only was I not allowed to use any points, there has been no one in customer service to respond to the numerous emails or calls that I have made. All my rides have been smooth till date, but the non existent customer service is a huge blocker if there are any questions or problems for your trip. There has been no way for me to reach out to anyone from the company.

There has been no way for me to reach out to anyone from the company.

originalText.text:
Strong Complaint Regarding Inhumane Treatment by Bus Driver and Nonexistent Customer Service

I am writing this to express my extreme dissatisfaction and disappointment with the experience my daughter and I had while traveling on one of your buses to New York City today. The series of events that unfolded during the trip were not only highly inconvenient but also demonstrated a complete disregard for customer service and basic human decency.
To begin with, we purchased two tickets for the trip, as my daughter, who had an important orchestra performance in New York City. Knowing that she needed to bring her violin along, we were shocked when the bus driver of bus number 3518 displayed an unprofessional and rude attitude towards us right from the start. He vehemently refused to allow us to bring the violin on board, even though we explained the delicate nature of the instrument and the urgency of the performance.
Despite our insistence that we had the right to bring our personal belongings on the bus, the driver threatened us with denial of boarding. Feeling cornered and left with no choice, we reluctantly placed the violin beneath the luggage bay. However, when the bus made a stop, I politely approached the driver once again, inquiring if it would be possible to place the violin case in the compartment above our seat. Instead of addressing the matter with professionalism, the driver responded rudely, threatening to expel us from the bus.
It is important to note that there was ample space available beneath our seat, which would have allowed us to keep the violin safe. However, the driver denied us this reasonable request and continued to exhibit impatience, speeding, and honking at other vehicles throughout the journey. When I attempted to remind him of the company policy, he dismissively informed me that he had no interest in hearing about it, displaying a complete lack of respect for his responsibilities.
The ordeal reached its peak when the bus stopped in New Jersey, and the driver hastily instructed everyone to switch to another bus. This sudden change created further inconvenience, as we were required to reload our luggage onto the new bus. When I approached the new driver and explained the previous driver's refusal to allow me to retrieve the violin, he confirmed that he had received instructions to deny my request. To seek a resolution, I politely requested a pass from the new driver, only to be confronted once again by the previous driver, who threatened to have me removed from the bus.
This relentless display of unprofessionalism, rudeness, and abuse of power was utterly unacceptable. I firmly reminded the driver that his actions were unlawful and that I would pursue legal action if necessary. Nevertheless, he proceeded to escalate the situation further by summoning the police and fabricating a different version of events. As a result, I was forcibly removed from the bus in the middle of nowhere, leaving my daughter and me feeling humiliated and stranded.
Furthermore, my attempts to contact your customer service department during and after the incident were met with complete silence.
The mistreatment we endured throughout this experience is not only deeply distressing but also a reflection of the overall lack of professionalism and consideration within your organization. As a customer, I expected a certain level of service and respect, which was sorely lacking.

This is the Booking Ref: GB2324903, if you want to investigate this incident. What bus company would leave their customers on the side of the road. No one would want to ride if they know the driver has a road rage problem. And during whole incident, the violin case is in the bus luggage bay, all I did was to ask the second shift driver if it is possible for me to bring it up the bus and placed under front seat. I can’t believe a bus company would hire such driver for employment, you are actually putting all the riders at risk.

Booking Ref: GB2325584 (this is the return tickets that we would never use)

originalText.text: Bus #6781 Leaving New York for Newport was prompt and on time, but the driver seemed to have had a heavy foot causing the bus to stop and go very frequently whereby making the ride extremely uncomfortable, the ride back to New York from Newport was 20 minutes delayed, and arrival nearly a 30 minutes late. The driver was doing the same go and stop motion as well on the way back. I would have liked a better driver and an on time departure and arrival. As for the customer service it was very good and very informative.

text.text: Bus #6781 Leaving New York for Newport was prompt and on time, but the driver seemed to have had a heavy foot causing the bus to stop and go very frequently whereby making the ride extremely uncomfortable, the ride back to New York from Newport was 20 minutes delayed, and arrival nearly a 30 minutes late. The driver was doing the same go and stop motion as well on the way back. I would have liked a better driver and an on time departure and arrival. As for the customer service it was very good and very informative.

originalText.text:
So far it's... not amtrak level of quality by any means. Wow, seats small enough you're touching the other passenger, crowded, rude driver, flickering lights that won't turn off, and we basically haven't even left yet. Less than a mile in and... Other passengers playing loud audio, bus driver driving poorly. Well. I paid less for it than amtrak... but when I get home i'm ordering tickets for next time I come down so it's still cheap enough where I don't have to do this bus again. lol
* update later
-we arrived around a hour late. Absolutely miserable.

Update a month later. Due to Amtrash hiking their fares around the holiday, I had to take this awful service again. Bus driver is so bad at his job his braking made a whole bus of people smash their heads on the hard plastic- for me it was around my eye. We were late again and they hiked the fare- $65 for this awful awful service is ridiculous. Please don't waste your time money and energy, trust me you'll hate it.

originalText.text:
Fist time taking the bus to Manhattan from Newton. MA. I won’t ever drive or fly again.
The list of things that make it so great for me are significant. There’s no security, no unwanted x ray screening, no crowded waiting area, no boarding by sections, no waiting, no crying babies, no carts moving up and down the isle, no restrictions on what I can carry on to east or drink, no line for the bathroom, no pitiful offering of pretzels and drinks. Just 2 seats to myself in complete silence and civility. Thank you GOBus.
